definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: He said the situation was dire and that time was of the essence.
sentences.chinese: 他說，形勢危急，需要當機立斷。

sentences.english: We'll have to take the bull by the horns and tackle the Medicare question.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須當機立斷，想辦法解決醫療保險問題。

sentences.english: The responsibility of command had habituated him to making quick decisions.
sentences.chinese: 指揮的職責使他習慣於當機立斷。

sentences.english: He never lets an opportunity slip; he's always on the mark.
sentences.chinese: 他總是當機立斷，決不錯過機會。

sentences.english: When you have reached agreement, close the deal firmly and clearly.
sentences.chinese: 一旦達成協議，當機立斷結束談判。

sentences.english: I would kill him, I wouldn't hesitate.
We need to grasp the nettle of prison reform.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要當機立斷，攻破獄政改革這個難題。

definition: to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
